column2: 5 GHz higher bandwidth, more channels and less crowded than 2.4 GHz, but range lower. 2.4 GHz range higher but slower bandwidth, fewer channels and more crowded.

802.11 - 2.4 GHz, up to 2 Mbps. 802.11a - 5 GHz, up to 54 Mbps, small coverage, not interoperable w. 802.11b and 802.11g. 802.11b - 2.4 GHz, up to 11 Mbps, longer range than 802.11a. 802.11g - 2.4 GHz, up to 54 Mbps, backwards compatible w. 802.11b w. reduced bandwidth capacity. 802.11n - 2.4 & 5 GHz, range from 150 Mbps to 600 Mbps, up to 70m range, APs & clients need multiple antennas using MIMO technology, backwards compatible w. 802.11a/b/g devices w. limiting data rates. 802.11ac - 5 GHz, range from 450 Mbps to 1.3 Gbps using MIMO technology, backwards compatible with 802.11a/n devices. 802.11ax - 2.4 & 5 GHz, a.k.a. Wi-Fi 6 or High-Efficiency Wireless (HEW), better power efficncy., higher data rates, handle many devices. Will use 1 & 7 GHz when available.

The common data formats that are used in many applications including network automation and programmability are as follows:
  • JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) - In JSON, the data known as an object is one or more key/value pairs enclosed in braces { }. Keys must be strings within double quotation marks " ". Keys and values are separated by a colon.
  • eXtensible Markup Language (XML) - In XML, the data is enclosed within a related set of tags data.
  • YAML Ain't Markup Language (YAML) - A superset of JSON. In YAML, the data known as an object is one or more key value pairs. Key value pairs are separated by a colon without the use of quotation marks. YAML uses indentation to define its structure, without the use of brackets or commas.

Related questions:

When There is a Root Port If one end of a segment is a root port, then the other end is a designated port.

column1: Designated Port When There is No Root Port
column2: Leaves segments between two switches where both switches is not the root bridge. Theport on the switch with the least-cost path to the root bridge is the designated port.
All ports on the root bridge are designated ports. This is because the root bridge has the lowest cost to itself.
A DHCP enabled client PC will send two broadcast messages - DHCPDISCOVER and DHCPREQUEST (see DHCPv4 Operation)

DHCPACK - the DHCP server confirming that the address lease has been accepted. DHCPREQUEST - The client accepting the IP address provided by the DHCP server. DHCPDISCOVER - Client initiating message to find a DHCP server. DHCPOFFER - DHCP responding to the initial request by a client.
67 and 68 (if there's only 1 option select 67)
Legitimate users will not be able to get valid IP addresses, Layer 2 attack.

Client sends Discover broadcast to find a DHCP server (DHCPDISCOVER) > Server responds init. request and sends Offer (DHCPOFFER) > Client accepts and sends Request (DHCPREQUEST) > Server confirms lease and sends DHCP Acknowledgement (DHCPACK)
In the interface to the network, type ip helper-address <ip address of DHCP server>. Verify using show ip interface.
In the interface to the network, type ipv6 dhcp relay destination ipv6-address [interface]. To verify, type show ipv6 dhcp interface.
Stateless - Enabled in RA messages with the ipv6 nd other-config-flag command. Clients send only DHCPv6 INFORMATION REQUEST msgs. Enabled on client using ipv6 address autoconfig command.
Stateful - M flag is 1 in RA msgs, uses address command to create pool of addresses, enabled on client using ipv6 address dhcp

Root port is selected based on the lowest overall cost (best path) to the root bridge. See Root Path Cost for calculating cost.

HSRP - Cisco prop., failover of first hop IPv4 device. (See HSRP for more info) HSRP for IPv6 - Same as HSRP but for IPv6. HSRP group has virtual MAC addr. derived from HSRP grp num and also virtual IPv6 link-local address. Periodic RAs are sent when HSRP grp is active. VRRPv2 - IPv4, one router is elected as master, rest are backups. VRRPv3 - Added support for IPv6. GLBP - Cisco Prop., allows load balancing. GLBP for IPv6 - Same thing but for IPv6. IRDP - Legacy, hosts locate routers that provide connectivity to other networks.

FlexConnect is a wireless solution for branch and remote office deployments, and allows you to control access points in a branch office from the corporate office through a WAN link, without deploying a controller in each office.

Connected mode - WLC is reachable, FlexConnect AP has CAPWAP connectivity with its WLC and can send traffic through CAPWAP tunnel.
Standalone mode - WLC in unreachable. FlexConnect AP can assume some of the WLC functions like switching client data locally and client authentication locally.

The switch checks the last field of the datagram against its own FCS calculations. FCS checks for errors to ensure the frame is free of physical and data link errors.
Part of HSRP. Hello messages are sent every 3 seconds by default. If no hello message is received for 10 seconds, the standby router will become the active one.
Transparent failover of first hope device; router. Used within a grp of routers for selecting active device and standby device for gateway services to a LAN.

column1: How does virtualization help with disaster recovery within a data center?
column2: Support of live migration

Cisco Proprietary Protocol. Uses active and standby routers. By default, device with the highest IPv4 addr is elected as the active router, except if a HSRP priority value is set. Priority is 100 by default, highest priority becomes active router. Active router sends Hello Messages every 3 seconds by default. Standby router becomes active one after 10 seconds if no hello message is received. No load balancing.

Initial - First state after config change or when interface first becomes available. Learn - Router has not determined the virtual IP addr and has not seen hello messages from the active router. It will be waiting for messages from the active router. Listen - The router knows the virtual IP addr, but the router is neither the active router nor the standby router. It listens for hello messages from those routers. Speak - The router sends periodic hello messages and actively participates in the election of the active and/or standby router. Standby - The router is a candidate to become the next active router and sends periodic hello messages. Active - The router won the election.

Functions of Hypervisors
  • To manage virtual machines
  • To allocate physical system resources to virtual machines

The hypervisor does not protect the hosting OS from malware. Neither does it allow sharing software across virtual machines. The hard drive of the supporting computer does not need to be partitioned to run virtual machines. The hypervisor creates and manages virtual machines on a host computer and allocates physical system resources to them.

Object IDentifiers (OID) uniquely identify managed objects in a MIB hierarchy. OIDs belonging to Cisco, are numbered as follows: .iso (1).org (3).dod (6).internet (1).private (4).enterprises (1).cisco (9). Therefore, the OID is 1.3.6.1.4.1.9.

A protocol that allows network devices to synchronize their time with an NTP server. NTP uses UDP port 123 and is documented in RFC 1305. End Device needs an IP or cannot connect to NTP server
Converts a port into a routed port.

Requires manual config of trunking or nontrunking. Trunk: Permanent trunking mode. switchport nonegotiate

Use a hierarchical system of time sources. Each level is called a stratum. Stratum level is defined as the number of hop counts from the authoritative source. The synchronized time is distributed across the network by using NTP.
Stratum LevelDescription
0No delay, non-network high precision timekeeping devices. Eg, Atomic & GPS clocks. Most accurate authoritative time sources.
1Network devices that R directly connected to Auth time sources. Acts as the primary network time standard to stratum 2 devices using NTP.
2 and belowStratum 2 servers R connected to Stratum 1 devices through network connections. Stratum 2 devices, such as NTP clients, synchronize their time by using the NTP packets from Stratum 1 servers. They can also act as servers for Stratum 3 devices.
The max hop count is 15. Stratum 16 = unsynchronized.
Time servers on same stratum level can be configured to act as a peer with other time servers on the same stratum level for backup or verification of time.
Cisco Proprietary Protocol. PAgP packets are sent between EtherChannel-capable ports to negotiate the forming of a channel. For PAgP modes, see PAgP States.

On - Force channel without PAgP exchanges. Desirable - Active negotiating state, initiates negotiations by sending PAgP packets. Auto - Passive negotiation state, receives & responds but does not initiate PAgP negotiation. (On-On, Desire-Desire, Desire-Auto)

shutdown (Default) - Port goes to error-disabled state, port LED off, send syslog msg, incr. violation counter. Admin must manually shut and no shut. restrict - Drop packets until no. of secure mac addr decreases below max value or max value is increased. Sends syslog msg and incr. violation counter. protect - Least secure, same as restrict except no syslog msg and no violation counter increase.
Check using show port-security

Blocking, Listening, Learning, Forwarding, Disabled. Blocking - Only receives BPDU, no MAC addr table updates, no forwarding data frames. Listening - Receives and sends BPDU, no MAC addr table updates, no forwarding data frames. Learning - Receives and sends BPDU, MAC addr table updates, no forwarding data frames. Forwarding - Receives and sends BPDU, MAC addr table updates, forwarding data frames. Disabled - Everything no

A single switch which is used as a reference point for all path calculations. The root bridge is selected in an election process. (See Election of Root Bridge (STP))
The root port is the port closest to the root bridge in terms of overall cost (best path) to the root bridge. Paths with the lowest cost become preferred, and all other redundant paths are blocked
Ports on a Layer 3 switch that are used for routing. For configuration, see no switchport.

Where a router is being used to route traffic between vlans, and one connection between a router & switch serves all of the vlans. The interface on the router will have subinterfaces which connect to each vlan. To connect to a switch, you need to use trunking.

Unsolicited messages alerting the SNMP manager to a condition or event on the network such as a link being down. Trap-directed notifications reduce network and agent resources by eliminating the need for some of SNMP polling requests.
Select root bridge > Block redundant path > Loop free topography > Link failure = recalculate path.

Prevent L2 loops which can result in broadcast storms by disabling redundant paths. Can calculate best path when there is a failure. No STP = Endless loop of frames + high CPU utilization n MAC address table instability.
Pretty much the same as Telnet but SSH has encryption so more secure.
In the vty lines, enter transport input all / transport input ssh / transport input telnet.

Two characteristics: Error checking and Automatic buffering. Error checking does a frame check sequence (FCS) after receiving the whole frame. If the frame has no errors, it Is forwarded. Otherwise, it is dropped. Automatic Buffering allows flexibility for different Ethernet speeds.

STP - Original IEEE version, assumes 1 spanning tree regardless of VLANs. PVST+ - Cisco enhancement of STP, provides separate tree instance for each VLAN, supports PortFast, UplinkFast, BackboneFast, BPU guard & filter, root and loop guards. RSTP - Faster upgrade of STP. Rapid PVST+ - Cisco enhancement of RSTP, each separate tree insurance supports the services above in PVST+. MSTP - IEEE standard, maps multiple VLANs to same spanning tree instance. MST - Same physical and logical topology as MSTP, provides 16 instances of RSTP and combines many VLANs into the same physical and logical topology as RSTP instance. Supports services like PVST+ above.
In the subinterface config (e.g. interface G0/0/1.10 for vlan 10), type encapsulation dot1Q <vlan id>, then type ip add <ip addr> <subnet mask>. (Good to put description too)
Faster switching of packets, and there is no need for a connection to a router.

1. Switch loads and executes Power-On-Self-Test (POST)
  2. Switch loads boot loader software.
  3. Boot loader performs low-level CPU initialization.
  4. Boot loader initializes flash memory.
  5. Boot loader locates and loads default IOS image.
Store & forward: Check for errors, if err drop frame, auto buffering for duplex mismatch. Cut-through: Ignore errors, less latency.

Uses CAM table which maps MAC addresses to ports (interface). When a frame is received,  switch checks Source MAC in CAM table, if not in CAM table, add MAC and port to table. Else, send to port in addr table. If dest. MAC is not in CAM table, broadcast to all ports except ingress port. Else, send to port in CAM table.

In a typical two-tier spine-leaf topology, every lower-tier switch, or the leaf layer, is connected to each of the top-tier switches, or the spine layer in a full-mesh topology.

However, the lower-tier switches are not connected to each other due to scalability issues in large networks.

WPAN - Wireless Personal-Area Network, low powered transmitters, short range network, based on 802.15 standard and 2.4 GHz. WLAN - Wireless LAN, uses transmitters to cover medium sized network. Suitable for home, office and campus. Based on 802.11 standard, uses 2.4 or 5 GHz.  WMAN - Wireless Metropolitan Area Network, uses transmitters to cover a larger geographic area, suitable for cities / districts, use specific licensed frequencies. WWAN - Wireless Wide Area Networks, uses transmitters to cover an extensive geographic area, suitable for national and global comms, also use specific licensed frequencies.

A URI is a string of characters that identifies a specific network resource while a URL defines the network location of a specific resource on the network.

show running-config - Shows currently running configuration. show ip interface - Shows IP configuration of interfaces. show vlan - Shows VLAN configuration. show interfaces trunk - Shows trunk configuration, along with native VLAN.

Smaller bcast domains, more security as devices can only comm. in same vlan, improved network efficiency & perf., cost reduction as no need to buy switches, simple project & app mgment. Separate functions makes specialised apps easier.
Devices can only communicate within the same vlan. e.g. broadcast cannot go from vlan 20 to vlan 30.

To delete only 1 vlan, in global config, enter no vlan <vlan id>. To delete all vlans, in exec mode, run delete flash:vlan.dat. Ports won't be disabled, but they will just stop communicating with the attached devices.

A VLAN Hopping Attack where the attacker embeds a hidden 802.1Q tag inside the frame that already has an 802.1Q tag. This allows the frame to go to a VLAn that the original 802.1Q tag did not specify.

The native and user VLANs being the same makes it vulnerable to VLAN double-tagging attacks.

Type - Value for the tag protocol ID value. VLAN ID - VLAN number. User Priority - Value that supports level or service implementation. Canonical Format Identifier - Identifier that enables Token Ring frames to be carried across Ethernet links.

column2: Windows will automatically set the IP address to start with 168.254.

Omnidirectional - 360 deg coverage, ideal for home, open office area, conference room, outdoors. Directional - Focus radio signal in one direction, stronger signal strength in one direction and reduced in other directions. Multiple Input Multiple Output (MIMO) - Multiple antennas to increase bandwidth for 802.11n/ac/ax networks, up to eight transmit and receive antennas can be used.
Access point may be operating in active mode.
Personal - One shared password for all users. Enterprise -Users need to login with username and password, RADIUS server authenticates them.
FFFF.FFFF.FFFF

Figure 1 shows 4 PCs (PC1, PC2, PC3 and PC4) with their MAC addresses shown are connected to a switch. Currently, the switch has only 1 entry in its MAC address table.



Please refer to Figure 1 for all the following questions.
  1. What happens to the Switch MAC address table when PC4 sends a frame addressed to PC3?
    2. The MAC address table will be updated with the MAC address of PC4 and its connected port.
  2. What action will the switch do when PC3 sends a frame addressed to PC1?
    3. The switch will flood this frame to all other ports (1, 4, 12)
  3. What destination MAC address will PC2 use to send a frame to all the PCs?
    4. The destination MAC address is the broadcast address FFFF.FFFF.FFFF
